parameters.name: client_name
parameters.description: name of the client for which subscription is created

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: name of the client for which subscription is created

parameters.name: sub_plan
parameters.description: sub_plan ('AISTrial', 'AISStandard', 'AISEssentials', 'AISAdvanced')

parameters.name: sub_months
parameters.description: number of months subscribed (1 or 12)

post.description: To manage subscription plan for new client

put.summary: Create a new client request : This API accepts the user request for AIShield Vulnerability Analysis and
put.description:
To manage subscription plan for new client
Defense Generation.

parameters.name: JobID
parameters.description: Enter the Job ID to get model artifacts and various reports (Vulnerability, Defense and Attack_samples)

parameters.name: ReportType
parameters.description: Enter the Report Type (Options : Vulnerability , Defense, Defense_artifact, Attack_samples)

parameters.name: FileFormat
parameters.description: Enter the File format Type (Options : {0 = all,1 = txt , 2 = pdf, 3 = json, 4 = xml})

get.summary: GetReport : This API request fetches report and artifacts for a given JobID
get.description: Get reports and artifacts for a given JobID

parameters.name: JobID
parameters.description: Enter the Job ID to get its metadata information

get.summary: JobDetail : This API request fetches the metadata with monitor link for a given JobID

parameters.name: JobID
parameters.description: Enter the Job ID to get its status

get.summary: JobStatusDetailed : This API request fetches the progress of a given JobID

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: model_id received during model registration

parameters.name: model_api_details
parameters.description: If use_model_api is Yes, providing API details as encrypted JSON                                     string is mandatory

parameters.name: use_model_api
parameters.description: If Yes, provide model_api_details else upload a model file in zip

parameters.name: normalize_data
parameters.description: Model trained on Normalized data (Options : Yes , No)

parameters.name: input_dimensions
parameters.description: Input dimensions of the image (eg, 48,48,3)

parameters.name: number_of_classes
parameters.description: Number of prediction classes(<200)

parameters.name: attack_type
parameters.description: Attack type (Options : Blackbox (No information about Model, Data and Parameters) , Greybox (Some information about Model, Data and Parameters

parameters.name: number_of_attack_queries
parameters.description: Number of attack queries (<400000)

parameters.name: model_framework
parameters.description: Model frameworkinformation (eg.tensorflow)

parameters.name: vulnerability_threshold
parameters.description: Threshold percent of stolen model accuracy at which defense model should be generated (enter value between 0.0 - 1

parameters.name: defense_bestonly
parameters.description: Options : Yes to select highly optimised model and No will return optimised model

parameters.name: encryption_strategy
parameters.description: Options: 0 if model is uploaded directly as a zip, 1 if model is encryted as .pyc and uploaded as a zip. Ignore if use_model_api is Yes

post.summary: Vulnerability Scanning and Defense : This API accepts the user request for AIShield Vulnerability Analysis and Defense Generation
post.description: Input all required parameters to perform Vulnerability analysis and Defense generation on the Image Classification model provided. Limited Original data is required as a zip file with images accepted in .jpg OR .png format. Further label information is required in a zip format with .csv file having image name and its class as two columns

parameters.name: task_type
parameters.description: ImageClassification (IC)

parameters.name: analysis_type
parameters.description: attack type to be analysed

info.title: AIShield Service
info.description: AIShield Services for Vulnerability and Defense against Model Extraction Attacks

tags.description: Services for Vulnerability and Defense against to Model Extraction Attacks for Image Classification Usecases
